    • Method Detail

      • formatValue

        public void formatValue(java.lang.StringBuffer toAppendTo,
                        java.lang.Object value)
        Format a value according the format string.

        NOTE: this method must be thread safe! In particular, if it uses a Format instance that is not thread safe, i.e. DateFormat, this method must be synchronized, either on the method, if the format is a final property, or on the format instance itself.

        (${t_ac33b65c7cc948319324ff5275fc8790})
        Specified by:
        formatValue in class CellFormatter(${t_dc51e711466e4d7dbf8596ac62699704})
        Parameters:
        toAppendTo - The buffer to append to.(${t_30ba1304886a447bb86aec01ea829914})
        value - The value to format.(${t_f063cf2fd2354ef885af9a77af65fcd7})

      • simpleValue

        public void simpleValue(java.lang.StringBuffer toAppendTo,
                        java.lang.Object value)
        Format a value according to the type, in the most basic way.

        NOTE: this method must be thread safe! In particular, if it uses a Format instance that is not thread safe, i.e. DateFormat, this method must be synchronized, either on the method, if the format is a final property, or on the format instance itself.

        For a date, this is "mm/d/y".

        (${t_45581424e026422892736ff1defcd1d6})
        Specified by:
        simpleValue in class CellFormatter(${t_1c46fb0e149142ca8ee4764dd7eddc71})
        Parameters:
        toAppendTo - The buffer to append to.(${t_537edf6dd61c48f980026e8db9eb5da7})
        value - The value to format.(${t_a9074b2c5eb34a919e78819b115190df})
